body_html: I figured out what was going on. I was setting inter_op_parallelism_threads and intra_op_parallelism_threads to specific values and that wasn't being reflected in test_session. I see now that it's possible to pass it an explicit ConfigProto object and that solves the problem.
body_text: I figured out what was going on. I was setting inter_op_parallelism_threads and intra_op_parallelism_threads to specific values and that wasn't being reflected in test_session. I see now that it's possible to pass it an explicit ConfigProto object and that solves the problem.
body: I figured out what was going on. I was setting `inter_op_parallelism_threads` and `intra_op_parallelism_threads` to specific values and that wasn't being reflected in `test_session`. I see now that it's possible to pass it an explicit `ConfigProto` object and that solves the problem.
